main event: A bright, disc-shaped object approximately 20 feet in diameter was observed in the sky above Trotwood, Ohio on September 6, 1959.
interesting points: The object became slightly blurred and gradually faded away to the west.
The object moved in an unusual manner, including stopping and then raising away to the east.
The witness estimated the object's speed as around 1,800 mph.
The witness estimated the object was about 100 miles away.
The witness reported a buzzing sound and that the object had flashing lights.
result: Possibly a balloon or other vehicle, though some properties indicated something unusual.
sighted object: Disc-shaped object approximately 20 feet in diameter
photographs: Yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
